{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"About the Service"}
1.1 The Service aims to provide realtime bus and river bus arrival information to members of the public using SMS, web and mobile web services.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Charges for the SMS Service"}

2.1 We will provide the SMS Service to you at a charge of 12 pence per text over your standard network rate. This charge may change in the future, but any change will be noted here and publicised by TfL. Texts via overseas networks are charged at the network's standard roaming rate only, but are limited to five per day. Please see tfl.gov.uk/terms for more details. The overall cost of sending a text may vary depending on the contract you have with your mobile network operator. You should check with your operator if you are unsure of the amounts charged to you for sending and receiving texts.
2.2 You will not be charged by us if:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["You do not receive a text from us using the SMS Service","Our system is not working. Your mobile network operator may still charge the standard network rate for sending a text"]}

2.3 Each request you make for bus or river bus arrival information using this SMS Service will be treated as a one-off transaction. You will only be provided with bus/river bus arrival information relating to the specific text you send to us. The SMS Service is not an agreement to send to you further texts and does not operate as a subscription service.
2.4 The SMS Service is provided by us for use only in the United Kingdom. You cannot use this service if you are outside of the United Kingdom.
